sub_topic: Calculation of the ionization energy of atoms
message_1: What is the ionization energy of Hydrogen gas when a single electron is removed from the ground state?
message_2: The ionization energy of hydrogen gas when a single electron is removed from the ground state is 13.6 electron volts (eV). This is the energy required to remove an electron from the n=1 energy level (ground state) of a hydrogen atom.
